entry.text: The official language of Liechtenstein is German.
The largest city of Europe is Moscow, with a total of 12.68 million people.
Funafuti is the capital city of Tuvalu.
Children's day is celebrated in Turkey every year on April 23.
On April 15, 1865, Abraham Lincoln is shot in the head while watching a theater play. He died of his wounds the following day.
The Republic of Turkey was officially proclaimed on October 29, 1923, under Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk's leadership.
The most commonly used spice in traditional Maldivian cuisine is cumin.
The most consumed beverage in medieval Europe was ale.
"Zeybek" is known as the traditional dance of Ege region.
The average surface temperature of Pluto is around 44 Kelvin.
The typical duration of a neuron's action potential is about 1 to 2 milliseconds.
Euler's number (also known as "e" in short) is approximately equal to 2.71828.
The first mechanical calculator was invented by Blaise Pascal.
Paper arrived in Europe during the 12th century.
The scientific paper named "Attention is all you need" is known as a huge milestone in AI field.
